on Thursday, he would earn about$ 334.7 million on the stock sale. He would still own about 2.7 percent of Google Inc. 's outstanding capital stock, down from 2.9 percent before selling the shares. As Google Inc. has grown, managing the business has become more complicated. So Larry, Sergey Brin and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making, Eric Schmidt said in a posting on the company's official blog. "And over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured."

not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012. Mr. Mike Pence ruled out a White House bid in a letter to supporters that also fueled speculation he is instead planning a run for governor. We have been especially humbled by the confidence and support of those who believe we should pursue the presidency, but after much deliberation and prayer, we believe our calling is closer to home, Mr. Mike Pence wrote in the letter. "In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana. We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012."

Labour deputy leader Harriet Harman , speaking on Sky News, said: Hacking into people's phones is illegal. Obviously the criminal law has got to be complied with and if it is broken then it should be investigated by the police and it should be enforced. "Nobody is above the law, no newspaper editor, no journalist.
